result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavonta Lavon Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Prepare/Make Fraud.Insur.Claims(<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.395(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Pay restitution in the amount of $12,483.72 to American Family Insurance. Attorney Uller will be sending the check. Any assessments, programming or treatment including cognitive thinking as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 90 days and the balance will be STAYED. Granted Huber for work.

Defendant Shavonta Lavon Simpson in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Plea to count 1, count 2 & count 3.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1, count 2 & count 3.

Count 1- 9 Months RCJ, i/s, 2 Years Probation

Count 2- 9 Months RCJ, i/s, 2 Years Probation, to run consecutive to count 1

Count 3- 9 Months RCJ, i/s, 2 Years Probation, to run consecutive to count 1 & count 2

Conditions:
120 days RCJ, defendant to serve 90 and the balance will be STAYED on count 1 only
Huber for work
No drugs, no alcohol
Any assessments, programming or treatment deemed appropriate by the agent, including cognitive thinking
Maintain employment
Court costs on all counts
Pay restitution in the amount of $12,483.72 to American Family Insurance - Attorney Uller will be sending the check
Report on Saturday September 17th @ 8:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shavonta Lavon Simpson in court with attorney Joshua Uller.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
